data.title: Evelyn Rice — Chicago Dance Connection
data.text: Evelyn Rice is the founder and director of The Exposure Movement, Inc., an artist development company that exposes and educates young artists through media and performing arts. She received her MS in Entertainment Business at Full Sail University. She has been working on-camera and behind-the-scenes in the entertainment industry for many years. Evelyn has been fortunate to learn and grow through several arrangements of multimedia events. From choreographing routines for College and High School dance teams, to modeling, performing and directing Arts & Entertainment projects nationwide, venturing onto dance stages with recording artists including, Kimberly Locke, Jennifer Holiday, Alfonso Hunter, Twista, and native Chicago artists, such as K.W.O.E., Drew Sidora, Endiskize, Javante Monet, and Kim Keller. Evelyn was also featured in Atlantic recording artist, Bayje’s music video, “Jealous of Your Whip.” Her passion is constantly being fed from the talented people she has the honor of training with and working alongside. In 2012, Evelyn collaborated with OSIP and Agency EA to direct an extravagant corporate stage production for Ameriprise Financial. She also worked with Stage Factor and KMS on a flash mob for America’s Beauty Show 2012. As a freelance choreographer, she works with many studios, high schools, and colleges all over the country, which compete at Regional and National conventions/competitions. Evelyn is a hip-hop educator for the Chicago National Association of Dance Masters (CNADM). She has worked with numerous studios and companies throughout Chicago, including Visceral Dance Center, and coached competitive teams at Soul2Sole Dance Studio from 2003-2017. Here, she was able to train, prepare, and showcase dancers in industry-related projects Nationwide, such as concerts, music videos, etc., through the platforms of Exposure L.A., Exposure NYC, and Exposure Chicago. Other credits include Visceral Solus 2018- “Force of Nature,” Dreamstar Productions 2013-16, The Carnival 2012-14, Pivot Point International 2010, 2008 Future Vision Tour, Vicious, Dance 2XS, UDA, Varsity.com, Cheer and Dance Association (CDA), America’s Beauty Show, The Chicago Confidential, WGN-TV, Glamour Magazine April 2007 issue, NIKE Rockstar Workout Winner 2006, The Oprah Winfrey Show, Janet 20 Y.O.—The Project.
